snippet: As the Army faces constricted spending, Gen. Ray Odierno said it would reduces its forces through attrition and work to retain military expertise earned in recent years.
abstract: United States Army Gen Ray Odierno, who faces major challenges because of budget restraints, assures his soldiers that the Army's five-year drawdown to 490,000 soldiers from a post-9/11 peak of 570,000 will be accomplished mostly through attrition; says retaining expertise earned since September 11 will be a priority.
lead_paragraph: As the Army faces constricted spending, Gen. Ray Odierno said it would reduces its forces through attrition and work to retain military expertise earned in recent years.
